optProblem

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • optProblem.Point

  • public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    group2

    This class will store a Point, i.e., a pair of (x,y) values. No attributes are static so each object will have their own. Equals, Hashcode and toString were overridden.

      Constructor for the Point Class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Point

        public Point(int xx,
             int yy)
        Constructor for the Point Class. It should only receive 2 integers and will associate each to the corresponding point in the class.
        Parameters:
        xx - is the x value to be stored
        yy - is the y value to be stored

      • findSamePoint

        public static int findSamePoint(java.util.List<Point> points,
                                Point point)
        Method that returns the index of the list in which we can find the point passed as argument. In case the said point wasn't found it will return -1.
        Parameters:
        points - is the list of points where we want to search
        point - is the point we want to find
        Returns:
        is the index in which we found the point or -1 in case it wasn't found

      • getX

        public int getX()

      • getY

        public int getY()

      • clonePointList

        public static java.util.List<Point> clonePointList(java.util.List<Point> list)
        Method to clone an Array List of Points. The clone relies on the Constructor and is done in a for loop iterating over the points in the list. This way we get 2 lists in memory, each with their own objects. If we change one of them it will not change the other.
        Parameters:
        list - is the original list we want to clone
        Returns:
        is the new list, a clone of the original one
